title: Tennis doubles runs in the blood at London 2012
description: LONDON， July 23 (Xinhua) -- A record number of sibling pairing are competing in the tennis tournament at the London 2012 Olympic Games， with five couples -- two sets of brothers and three sets of sisters -- playing in the men's and women's doubles.
cleanContent: LONDON, July 23 (Xinhua) -- A record number of sibling pairing are competing in the tennis tournament at the London 2012 Olympic Games, with five couples -- two sets of brothers and three sets of sisters -- playing in the men's and women's doubles.Four of the duos competed at Beijing, while two of the sibling sets competing at London 2012 are from the same NOC: Venus and Serena Williams and Bob and Mike Bryan, both from the United States.The Bryan brothers, who are twins, are competing in their third Olympic Games. They won bronze at Beijing.The Williams sisters are the defending Olympic champions in the women's doubles and both are also competing in the women's singles at London 2012. Serena Williams won her fifth singles Wimbledon championship in early July, equaling her sister's record here.The brothers-in-arms Jamie and Andy Murray, who competed in the men's doubles in Beijing. Andy, who is the younger of the two by almost two years, will also compete in the singles. He was defeated by Swiss Roger Federer in the singles final at this year's Wimbledon championships.Alona and Kateryna Bondarenko from Ukraine, who were defeated in the bronze medal match in Beijing, will compete in both the women's singles and women's doubles.Pole Agnieszka Radwanska, runner-up in this year's Wimbledon women's singles final, will play in the women's doubles in London with her younger sister Urszula, who is making her Olympic Games debut.Both the Radwanska sisters are also competing in the women's singles.																																																																								|  |
